Reviews.Title: “relatively average hotel, but convenient, clean & quiet”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelguy1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is essentially what I expected for the money in Berlin. Actually, the price was quite fair. When you pay this much (or this little) for a hotel, you can't expect it to be a beautiful top-quality stay, but I was looking for clean and quiet. This I got. I will say that I had to change rooms a few times. The first room was at the end of the hallway and the wifi (free) signal was not strong enough to stay connected. The second room that they gave me was a smoking room and while it didn't reek, it was not terrifically pure smelling. Overall, I slept well there. The beds were comfortable and the internet was reliable. I would recommend this hotel for those purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Best week ever”
Reviews.Author: shelle1971
Reviews.Content: My daughter and, i stayed here for a week and, what a wonderful week it was. Everybody in the hotel was helpful and, friendly, they made us feel a part of a family while we where there. The food was lovely and, the service was excellent. The hotel is placed in an ideal place close to taxi's cafe's and, the Ku'damm but, enough away so not to be bothered by noise day or night. I enjoyed my stay there so much that i can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Lahvik
Reviews.Content: Originally we were travelling to London, but due to visa problems we were sent back home from the Prague airport. As we did not want our weekend to be ruined completely, we have decided on last minute to go to Berlin and hotel Mercure. GREAT CHOICE! The hotel is located just few minutes walking distance from U-Bahn station near the street Kurfurstendamm. We arrived about 11:15 p.m. and had a very nice check-in by the night receptionist Herbert. We got a room 401 on the 4th floor, even better than we expected. Large room, totally clean, modern, beautiful bathroom.. Great bed, after all the travelling we slept like angels. :-) We had a room breakfast excluded, however we paid 12 EUR/person extra and we took it. Another great choice. Best breakfast we have ever had in any hotel. Unbelievable choice. Everything tasted fresh and great. Also very good stuff working there. Always smiling. So no wonder we paid for a breakfast also next morning. Only thing which did not work during our stay was internet, neither wifi connection, neither the computer down in the lobby. But that was not a problem, as Emina at the reception explained for us everything we needed to know (like how to get somewhere and stuff). On Saturday we went to Tropical islands, but as it was really nice weather, we took a long walk around Tiergarten to Brandenburger Tor, Unter den Linden and further on up to train station Ostbahnhof for our train (S-Bahn) to Tropical islands. (We were a little disappointed from TI, as it was really not so warm in there, kinda like if you leave the shower early in the morning and go to cold hall). When we came back to our room that night, we found out cleaning ladies did a good job, everything was so clean again. :-) On our last day we wanted to go out for a walk before we had to leave back to Prague and pnce again we got some great suggestions from receptionist Christin, who was very nice to us and explained also few things we did not quite understood about Berlin. We took U-Bahn to Charlotenburg Schloss, took some pictures there and went back to hotel to pick up our luggage and went home. Overall - if you are going to Germany, this hotel should be your choice, because of the location, cleaningness, food, quality of rooms and sleep quality, extremely nice and helpful stuff. It's definitelly going to be our choice for a hotel next time we go to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: lesliedocherty-GLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst on business in Jan, The good points are 1) Free internet in room which is a great bonus, very few hotels in Berlin offer this, i know as my wife spent hours trying to find the ones that did. 2) Big rooms, my room was long and had plenty of space, great size room with a fold out couch, good for relaxing after a long day in Berlin. 3) Supermarket is right next day, its well priced, has amazing pastries and a great selection of fruit (great for making up breakfast). Bad points were 1) Rooms were quite dated, and a bit reminiscent of a 80's room, old decor and just a bit tired. 2) No English TV channels (not that you come to watch TV, but after spending the day round trade shows, a bit of TV would help) 3) Coffee/Tea making was there but not working, nowhere to plugin, no coffee supplied. Overall, it was average, i would stay again though as it done the job, nice big room with FREE internet, good location and a bit of updating would be nice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Katnas
Reviews.Content: My family and I were there for the new year and it wS amazing!! I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. The location, service, breakfast and rooms were amazing. It is close to Kudam and exactly beside the hotel is a large supermarket. All and all a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Sound hotel with some glitches”
Reviews.Author: davidhchess
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated near the Savigny Platz SBahn and the KuDamm. We stayed for five days in a room that was a good size and reasonably well appointed. There were some minor irritations: small cup sizes, no coffee, no close power point to boil the kettle. The major issue for me as I needed to work was that wifi was not reliable the further away you were from the lift. In our room service was so poor that I was reduced to going to reception to log in or bringing my iPad with me to breakfast. The bathroom was acceptable, though the absence of a bar of soap would irritate some as would the rather old fashioned shower curtain. There was some road and activity noise audible but we did not think that this was too intrusive. Breakfast was fine in both quality and quantity.

Reviews.Title: “Visit the city of my Birth”
Reviews.Author: Wahlenglaender
Reviews.Content: We choose the Chateau Hotel because it is a 4star hotel and in the middle of the city. The situation is ideal, the rooms are bright and friendly. Reception staff speaks good English and gives advice where to eat etc. Breakfast was very good. I will definitively return there when I visit Berlin again. I have not found anything in this hotel that I disliked. It is just a few steps away from the Kurfuerstendamm. Unfortunately it is full of tourists - well you would expect that.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Rony61
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 times, each time for 6 nights. The hotel is near one of the main streets in town - KUDAM, many bus lines go through there. Very spacious rooms tastefully furnished and perfectly clean. The air conditioner works properly, there is a safe and a minibar in the room. Breakfast is varied and rich. Adjacent to the hotel there is a large supermarket. I would like to note especially the excellent service provided at the front desk by a clerk called ARAMIS who tries at every opportunity to help and take care that our stay at the hotel will be pleasant and comfortable, always patient and kind. ARAMIS is an asset to the hotel. We travel to Berlin at least twice a year and will continue to visit this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: NigelHa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located just off the Ku'damn. However I felt that the facilities were basic for the price. The room was a good size. However although there was tea avaiable there was no coffee and anything used was not replaced. Also the restaurant next door was noisy until the early hours of the morning. In particular I felt that there could have been more choice at breakfast eg. croissants only appeared once in the 3 days I was there.

Reviews.Title: “A small and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shimshon D
Reviews.Content: We found hotel Chateau to be a comfortable and welcoming hotel, mainly due to the reception team (Aramis, Kristin and others). They were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was only a two minutes walk from a bus station, 7 minutes from the S-bahn. The hotel itself is simple, but very clean and quite, and we found it ideal for our Berlin tour.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Yaniv H
Reviews.Content: had a week in Berlin and the hotel was fantastic. great food, great rooms and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: blimele
Reviews.Content: Chateau Garni belongs today to the Accor chain with the name Mercure Hotel Chateau am Kurfursterdamm. The hotel is good located, rooms are comfortable and large, but we were disappointed that the hotel has only one big elevator for all the rooms. ( waiting time during rush hours) We also experience some maintenance problems (obstruction in the balcony pipelines during rain and in general got the feeling of weak maintenance)

Reviews.Title: “between 3 and 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: omern
Reviews.Content: Location - west side. several minutes of walking to the the train station. Breakfast - pretty lame. Room - very very big, a bit old fashion, shower too small. Supermarket near the hotel. free WiFi!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay in Chateau hotel”
Reviews.Author: Idanp
Reviews.Content: My in laws stayed in this hotel during the beginning of September for 5 days. The hotel is located in a central location and accessible to all public transportation. The room was large, very clean, comfortable, has A/C. The staff is very polite and very patient. Breakfast was also great. They recommend this hotel to everyone they know.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: robishlomit
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel in the best place in Berlin .wery good brekfast,the service at the restaurant and in the front desk are exellent.Near the hotel a wery good supermarket ,not exensive.Restaurants cofee shops pubs and all kinds of tranportation are near the hotel. we enjoyed our vacation wery much

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in west Berlin”
Reviews.Author: rnissa
Reviews.Content: Hi, Normaly I don’t writhe tips about hotels but in this case I must, because this hotel is amazing!!! this hotel is in west Berlin in KU-Damm street in central west Berlin. I had such a good time there, the room was big the breakfast was with anything that I can imagine like eges, vegetubels. Penkiks and a lot of other stuuf. But the best thing about this hotel is the service, I have never seen such a dedicated and good service! I found this hotel in facebook throw one of my friend www.facebook.com/home.php?#!/profile.php?id=100000728713837

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronby1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent example to a hotel you're coming to without any expectations and it surprises you for good!!! We had a wonderful stay at the hotel which is decorated beautifully and with great taste. I would like to add the great service the hotel offers and the very big breakfast buffet the hotel has. We are surly coming back!

Reviews.Title: “I would choose this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyedMyTrip
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Berlin, on the U-Bahn and buslines- close to the S (light rail) near all sorts of restaurants and shops, my travel agent recommended this hotel, and he was right. Rooms were clean, breakfast was generous and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “average... with advantages for families”
Reviews.Author: benyo3
Reviews.Content: better for families, less for couples the rooms are big and fit 3 beds nicely

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dunnard
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights mid week in November 2008. We chose it as we wanted to stay in this area of Berlin and this was one of the few hotels which included breakfast in the room rate. Do not be put off by the rather drab entrance. We had a bright, nicely furnished, large room with a fridge, room safe, TV with some foreign news channels and en suite marble bathroom with bath and over-bath shower. The staff at reception were very helpful. We arrived at 10am after an early flight and, although the check in time was 3pm and our room wasn’t ready, they had it cleaned and made available to us within an hour. The buffet breakfast included a wide selection of hot and cold food – the staff were attentive and the dishes regularly replenished. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very recommended Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: tfishler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel Great location great Service For me this hotel is one of the bests. Clean rooms - nice breakfast, Located in the Center of West Berlin A Supermarket is located next to the hotel Restaurants and shopping are at the same street. Good price what else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: editorincharge
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed wonderful service at the Chateau. Rooms were spacious and clean. Breakfast was great and the food was excellent. The hotel is located off the Ku'Dam, with shopping and transportation nearby. The staff spoke English and was always helpful. The furniture in the lobby was a bit gothic, but that's just a matter of taste. All in all, a reasonably priced hotel smack in the middle of Berlin's main shopping drag.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed every minute”
Reviews.Author: howie25
Reviews.Content: Had a terrific stay. Reception staff very freindly. Requested non-smoking room, was given one on the third floor. Room spacious modern and clean. Excellent breakfast, meat prepared and served on a seperate section making it most convenient for strict vegetarians like myself. The hotel is centraly situated, very close to public transport and in walking distance to the synagogue.

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ClareGa
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights in November on a package deal. Although the decor is a little dated, we loved this hotel and it deserves a higher Tripadvisor rating. The location is excellent, 5 minutes from the S (the overhead railroad), not far from one of the main transportation stations at the Zoolgical Gardens and just off one of Berlin's main roads, the Kur'dam from where one can catch buses to almost everywhere. The room was a nice size, the bed was really comfortable, the bathroom looked new, the hotel was clean and breakfast was great. As a vegetarian, I found there was a great selection. An added advantage was the free internet in the lobby. The staff were very helpful. You can also buy bus tickets in the lobby. The hotel has a really nice supermarket right next door and we found the prices there cheaper than at other supermarkets. Although there is a disco next door, you can't hear the music in the rooms. Berlin is a fantastic city to visit and we were sorry we didn't have at least a week to explore the city (and the department stores). The transportation system is the best I have seen and we didn't see one traffic jam the whole time we were there. We bought daily tickets that allowed us unlimited travel on all forms of public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: cathmalc
Reviews.Content: Very good value,good location,staff very helpful.Large rooms,this hotel would be twice the price in London.S9 fron airport to Savignyplatz,5 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Avi_4321
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Spacious, very clean, renovated, comfortable beds. Quiet (we requested a room facing the back). We are very sensitive to clean and quiet rooms and were fully satisfied with our room. Breakfast (included) was rich and very good. Location: Very good, 5 minutes from S/U-Bahn or Bus to everywhere. A supermarket just next door. Downside: 1. Bath curtains were removed on the second day of our stay for cleaning and were not returned till we left three days later, but this is not a big issue as we got enough towels instead. 2. Aircondition didn't cool enough. Outside temp. was 25C. If you come in the summer, make sure A/C works fine. Our overall experience was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but better stay in the east”
Reviews.Author: Tamika
Reviews.Content: Not a bad word to say about this hotel - just opened 2006, very clean, friendly helpful staff (didn't encounter the language problem previous reviewer mentioned), hearty breakfast, very comfortable. As mentioned, the hotel is just off kurfurstendam which is a central commercial street. 15 minutes walk from the zoo or Europa Center, where you can catch the 100/200 buses to practically all the tourist attractions (alternatively, bus M29 has a stop just on the corner of Kudam and knesebeckstarsse - 3/4 stations from Zoo/Europa Center). The tourist information at the Europa Center should be your first stop, as this is the place to get public transport tickets, maps and much more. A bit further up knesebeckstr. (crossing Kudam) you'll find an S-bahn station in Savignyplatz - all the trains go to Hauptbahnhof (new and impressive central train station), and the S7 southbound will take you to Potsdam. The hotel is quite close to the U-bahn stations on Kudam as well, so all in all public transport is very easy. Some nice restaurants around Savignyplatz as well. The west has lost most of its past glamour, and I didn't find it appealing at all, esp. comparing to the lively areas in the east - Kreuzberg, Prenzelaur Berg or Oranienburger str. I'd recommend staying in the Mitte district, around Unter den Linden or Gendarmenmarkt - much closer to most of the attractions, entertainment and night life, and will save you much time on transport.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the main centre!”
Reviews.Author: cassinigirl
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went to Berlin (mid world-cup) which was booked very last minute. We thought hotels would be very expensive, but after coming across this hotel on easyjet hotels, it was quoted as a 4 star, and for 3 nights and 4 days accommodation was only £120 for a double room if I remember correctly (costing more at the weekend than through the week). Still, a brilliant price mid-world cup. Although I wouldnt class the hotel as 4 star, I would say it was definitely a 3 star by UK standards. It was very clean, and newly built at the start of 2006. It has lifts and stairs, and the breakfast, which Is included was quite nice. The downstairs also joins onto the main supermarket (these are in small majority in Berlin, so it is great that this is next door), which is very well stocked with its own bakery etc. Surprisingly (especially during world cup fever time) the language barrier was quite certain. Although reception staff who were very friendly did their best to accomodate us, the bars and restuarants round about, was quite tricky (with very seldom having English written on the menus). There is a lovely Italian round the corner about a 5 minute walk, and the restaurant across from the hotel is tasty too! The hotel is a 15 minute walk to Berlin Zoo, and aquariam which made for a fun day out - although the animals did look a bit hot, and I didnt like it (being an animal biologist!!). It is a fun day out for the kids though, with lots of animals to see (although unless you can read German you have no idea what it is you are looking at as no signs in English!!). The hotel is situated off Kurfurstendam (the main strip in Berlin). Lots of shops, but expensive shops!! With so many side streets off Kurfurstendam, we did get lost, but found our way back by remembering that burger king is on the corner!! All in all, a nice stay and a brilliant price, and we would go back. It was a little noisy with people shouting at night (but we put this down to the football!). The air con was great and the bathroom with bath (and very powerful shower!) were very clean and splendid. There is also satellite TV, but be warned you only get CNN for 3 hours a day , the only channel for English speakers. Howver, MTV does come on for an hour a day between 4-5pm if you are lucky enough to catch it!

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Hotel Chateau
HotelInfo.Address: Knesebeckstrasse 38-49, 10719 Berlin, Germany (Formerly Ringhotel Chateau Garni)
